item.description:
Enjoy Historic New England's guided tour of Beacon Hill, and Otis House, which was designed by Charles Bulfinch. Here is a description of the tour: "Go beyond the brick sidewalks and charming gardens and learn about Beacon Hill’s development in the Federal era. The fortunes, ambitions, and struggles of Beacon Hill’s early residents, both wealthy and working class, shaped the streets, architecture, and character of the hill. The program starts with a tour of the Otis House, the earliest intact mansion in the neighborhood, and continues on Beacon Hill’s historic streets." The tour is $12.00, and is two hours. The tour guides recommend you call 617-994-5920 to register, or register online at http://shop.historicnewengland.org/p-6445-beacon-hill-walking-tour-august-6.aspx if you plan to attend the tour, since they can only accommodate 15 people. 

We will meet at Otis House at 10:45 am. Directions detail: The Otis House is at the foot of Beacon Hill, next to the Old West Church. The entrance is on Lynde Street.

Public transportation: Short walk from MBTA stations: Charles Street/MGH, Government Center, and North Station.

Here is a link to the Otis House website: www.historicnewengland.org/historic-properties/homes/otis-house

The tour will be ending at Beacon St. and the Boston Common. After the tour we will have lunch at Emmet's Irish Pub and Restaurant, which is located at 6 Beacon St, which is close to where the tour will be ending. This is a Beacon Hill neighborhood pub, but the food menu looks good. 

http://emmetsirishpubandrestaurant.com/
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the lobby of the Otis House Museum. I will have a Meetup sign with me.
item.name: Historic Walking Tour of Beacon Hill and Otis House
